intro: Sisymbrium erucastroides, commonly known as the narrowleaf mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Sisymbrium erucastroides is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
